title: Prime Media taps Lonergan Edwards for Seven West takeover
text:
Valuation firm Lonergan Edwards & Associates has been tasked with running the ruler over Seven West Media's $64 million bid for regional affiliate Prime Media.

Prime Media's board has asked Lonergan Edwards' number-crunchers to look at the bid, to check it was in the best interest of the company's shareholders. Prime's board said it would recommend Seven West's offer subject to the independent expert's report and in the absence of a superior offer.

Prime Media chairman John Hartigan has said Seven West's bid is in the best interest of his company's shareholders. Craig Abraham

Seven West has offered 0.4582 of its own shares for each Prime Media share. The deal valued Prime at $64 million and would see its investors own 10 per cent of the combined group.

Prime Media shares were up 1¢ to 19¢ on Monday morning.

Lonergan Edwards' appointment came as sell-side analysts took their own look at the offer.
